page.title: 03WATLING STREET
page.content: The Watling Street, or A5 as it is now known, runs in an almost straight line across our area. The original road was built by the Romans and ran from London to Holyhead in Anglesey. The road was improved by Thomas Telford in the early nineteenth century and became a toll road. The Old Coach Road in Bishops Wood joined the A5 and brought horse drawn coaches from London, via Wolverhampton on to Chester and North Wales. Until recently the road was very busy making life difficult for local people and businesses. The opening of the nearby M54, from Wolverhampton to Telford has taken much of the heavy traffic away.
